title: My Portfolio website
shortDescription: This portfolio website takes care of all my portfolios to maintain ( Add , Delete, Edit ) in a secure way.
technologiesUsed: Next.js with Node / Express, React, HTML, CSS, SASS, MongoDB / GraphQL
fullDescription:
I’ve created this website so I can present my apps so far and future ones, it was originally written in NextJs as server and React as frontend, but recently redone it completely with Java Spring Boot / Thymeleaf for better performance and also that this is the tehnologie I use now.

Technical details:

  • I used Thymeleaf on front End and on some pages a bit of javascript for AJAX requests for better performance
  • On backend I used Java / Spring boot v2.4.1
  • Maven as depencency management
  • I have integrated spring security where I have user basic authentication + a user may have more than one role
  • For development I integrated swagger also
  • As DB I use mongoDB that is integrated with MongoRepository in Spring Boot
  • It has the capability of zipping all portfolios and give me a link to download the zip file all grouped but each portfolio and have a json file with the compleate information about the project which I can reupload the portfolio back onto the website, this feature is to allow me the capability of having a backup of my portfolios
  • When uploading a portfolio pictures are automatically rescaled and compressed and optimized for better performance of the website  
  • Also has a service that deals with the emails, so in case of a user trying to contact me over the contact page it is possible.

 

Old description:

  • Has been created with Next.js for server side rendering and better SEO, also uses Node / Express as a static server, with MongoDB / Mongoose / GraphQL for better future maintainability, and frontend React / HTML / CSS / SASS / Bootstrap
  • Login system with roles so for CRUD operations on my portfolios only admin has the authority of making changes
  • I’m also using Redux for better app performance
  • Each CRUD request made to the server must have a valid JSON Web Token
  • App stores portfolio files in an organized way, each portfolio has their own file system, and database to keep track of them, and any changes made to them
  • App is also mobile/tablet friendly
